q_results.bio: Hi Hi. I design. I like food.
I'm a current Freshman in the School of Engineering. I am a prospective Mechanical Engineering major. My interests include photography, lacrosse, and sneakers.
I am a sophomore at Columbia College studying English and Computer Science.
Barnard Class of 2020. Planning on majoring in Architecture and minoring in Psycholgy. Obsessed with art, photography, design and cats.

Ian Hewitt is a Columbia College senior studying biological anthropology. He works as a research assistant and teacher's assistant in the Ecology, Evolution, and Environmental Biology department. To nobody's surprise, he has found himself disillusioned with Columbia and “the intelligentsia” in his last year here. He's from Southern California, but, defying stereotypes, he “has no chill.” The Cloisters runs alternate Wednesdays.

Anna Alonso is a Linguistics major in Columbia College, Class of 2018. At Spectator, she is in charge of running print and layout production, overseeing all graphics and illustrated content, and leading Spectator's product design team.

Lexi is a senior Art History + Urban Studies major at Barnard College. She is also a founding board member of the Journal of Art Criticism (JAC), and contributing graphic designer to numerous organizations on campus. You can almost always find her in Butler.

Charlotte Force is a hobbit and first-year at Columbia College working towards a degree in medieval studies and classics. She lived for eighteen years in Morningside Heights before moving across the street into the prime real estate that is the pages of her LitHum reading. Charlotte wants to be a professional nerd when she grows up (read: historian) and tends to forget her cup of tea when writing. You can find her on Twitter and Instagram as @cforcee. The Girl from 116th runs alternate Thursdays.

Nikita Singareddy is a Columbia College senior majoring in history and concentrating in statistics. She is an advisor to the Office of University Life and the Office of Student Conduct and Community Standards. She is also the former president of Columbia's Roosevelt Institute, a non-partisan, progressive think tank. When not wonking over public policy, you can find Nikita listening to podcasts or scouring Brooklyn for New York's best coffee. She hails from Melbourne, Australia but now resides in Georgia. Follow her on Twitter for witty hot takes: @singareddynm. Nik’s Declassified School Survival Guide runs alternate Tuesdays.

I'm a CC sophomore studying Urban Studies and Political Science. I cover  issues related to student life, student government and campus services. Outside of Spectator and Columbia, I'm a private-rated pilot and I work for a nonprofit that's sponsoring sustainable development in Senegal.
q_results.role: News Associate Staff Writer, Student Life-Admin

q_results.bio: Rébecca Ausseil is a Barnard College junior majoring in comparative literature and psychology and minoring in translation studies. When she’s not lying about being from the "greater New York City area" (also known as Jersey) , she’s decking The Eye office out in twinkling lights.
Neuroscience major at Columbia College. Class of 2019. I love Kanye like Kanye loves Kanye.

Patricia Pou Jové is a senior in Columbia College from San Juan, Puerto Rico. She studies History, Education Studies, and Barnumbia's Facebook culture. Patricia is a proud member of Chicanx Caucus, the Latinx community of Columbia, the Undergraduate History Council, and the Puerto Rican nation. Her hobbies include avoiding Butler, always ordering the same thing from Roti Roll, and telling people about the time she won the Hamilton lottery while simultaneously critiquing the award-winning musical phenomenon. She retweets multilingual memes at @ppoujove. Not Your Chica runs alternate Mondays.

David Sierra is a Columbia College junior majoring in English and women's and gender studies. They are a queer and trans writer and artist. You can find them sitting on the Q House stoop discussing structural oppression and intersectional feminist critique while wearing 9-inch platforms. They've written for MTV, performed at Brooklyn Arts Exchange, and organized with Fourth Arts Block. David grew up a small-town Ohio boy but always dreamed of becoming a big city girl. We’ll see what happens. Locate them on Twitter (@davidleesierra) and Instagram (@davidleesierra). Sex(uality) and the City runs alternate Fridays.

By day I'm a class of 2020 SEAS student leaning towards biomedical engineering with a minor in visual arts, but that changes every day. By night I'm an illustrator for Spectrum,  a foodie looking for the best ramen in NYC, and a regular browser of Dogspotting.

I'm a prospective neuroscience major and music concentrator in CC'20. I do not know where my career interests lie yet, but I've found photographing for Spectator to be a reliable creative outlet to keep me grounded each week. I plan to continue throughout my four years here, and when I reflect in retrospect after those years have past, I hope to have left a positive legacy for the Spectator's visuals.
I'm a current Freshman in the School of Engineering. I am a prospective Mechanical Engineering major. My interests include photography, lacrosse, and sneakers.
I am a Columbia College Sophomore studying Environmental Biology and pre-med.

I'm in the class of 2019 at Columbia College, although it's my first year here. Born and raised in New York, I'm studying Middle East, South Asian and African Studies, and the beautiful Arabic and Persian languages.

Daniel Bergerson is a Columbia College senior studying history and urban teaching. Similar to an Olive Garden Italian, he is an IKEA Swede who started his educational career playing children’s concerts in Minneapolis, Minnesota and ended up facilitating workshops in the high schools of Santiago, Chile. You can find him at the James Baldwin School, where he is a full-time student teacher, or editing for the Young Teacher’s Collective. Don’t get him started on Teach for America, but do ask about multicultural pedagogy and the Barnard Education Program. You can follow him on Twitter @DanielBergerson and read more at The Dandruff Report. The Red Pen runs alternate Wednesdays.

To keep things short, I'm a tech head, hip hop head, and BMW gear head, but on paper I shoot for Spec and am a first year searching my way through the odd Barnard + Columbia relationship to pursue an architecture major.

I am a Columbia College (CC'19) student studying literature and applied math. I illustrate in my spare time- what little spare time a double major gets. In illustrating for The Columbia Spectator, I have found that the more contentious the piece, the more interesting it is for me to convey.

Hello! I'm an architecture major at Barnard College, class of 2019. Most of my illustrations start out as pen and ink drawings, but from there I work with water colors, colored pencils, and/or Photoshop to reach the final product. When I'm not building models in studio or illustrating articles at Spec, I love to cook vegan meals, read graphic novels, stay hydrated, research the backstories behind Pixar movies, and hang out in Prospect Park.

I'm May, and I'm from CC, Class of 2020. My intended major is Econ. I enjoy randomly walking around, binge watching dramas, and intensive fangirling over a Korean boyband. I work in Spec as a staff designer for news, more specifically for Studen Life/Admin section.
Jaime is a member of the SEAS Class of 2020 as a prospective Civil Engineering major. Besides photography, his interests include structures and architecture, French studies, and digital art.
Margaret Corn is a Columbia College sophomore. She works as a staff designer for the Columbia Daily Spectator.

Paulina Mangubat is a Barnard College senior double majoring in political science and East Asian studies. As editorial page editor, Paulina runs campus discourse; as a result, she’s all too aware that the supposedly equal-opportunity “marketplace of ideas” is fraught with systemic inequalities and frustrating barriers to entry. No, she’s not interested in reading your thinkpiece about free speech. Just kidding! That would be a violation of your right to free speech. (No, but seriously. Don’t send her your thinkpiece about free speech.)

Jenna is a Barnard college senior majoring in Psychology. She is passionate about data journalism and the media industry and is looking forward to continuing her career in journalism after graduation.
I'm a freshman at Columbia College class of 2020. I plan on being a visual art major and love painting and illustrating. In my free time, I love listening to music and watching movies.

I'm May, and I'm from CC, Class of 2020. My intended major is Econ. I enjoy randomly walking around, binge watching dramas, and intensive fangirling over a Korean boyband. I work in Spec as a staff designer for news, more specifically for Studen Life/Admin section.

Yasmine is a sophomore at Barnard College, majoring in Environmental Science and minoring in Spanish and Latin American Cultures. She loves Kanye West, sneakers, and watching people's reactions when she tells them she's a triplet.
Margaret Corn is a Columbia College sophomore. She works as a staff designer for the Columbia Daily Spectator.

I'm a freshman at Columbia College majoring in visual arts. When I'm not designing for Spec, you can find me sketching or painting in all corners of campus. I'll most likely be drinking mint tea and representing my hometown Toronto by listening to some Drake tunes.

q_results.role: Associate Editor (View From Here), The Eye
q_results.bio: Crystal is a Film and Anthropology major in Columbia College, currently in her sophomore year. When she's not at the Spec office, her other interests include urban culture, travel, short fiction, and a good cocktail (preferably all at once).

Anna Raskind is a senior in Columbia College majoring in English. She is interested in mental health, feminism, linguistics, and multicultural studies. Anna is actively involved in social psychology and is a research fellow at the Laboratory of Intergroup Relations and the Social Mind, which studies racism, diversity, and stereotypes. Anna is half-Asian and half-Jewish and loves to reflect endlessly on these mixed identities. Previously, she wrote for Spectrum Opinion and The Eye. Anna is from Los Angeles, California but has lived in more places than she can count, including France, Arizona, and Michigan. Annalytical runs alternate Fridays.

Anna Alonso is a Linguistics major in Columbia College, Class of 2018. At Spectator, she is in charge of running print and layout production, overseeing all graphics and illustrated content, and leading Spectator's product design team.

I am a Columbia College sophomore, double majoring in American Studies and Sociology. Besides my involvement in Spectator Design, I am a tour guide, the Public Relations Vice President of Gamma Phi Beta, and Executive Board Member and Events Director of Youth for Debate.
Rosie is in the SEAS class of 2020. She plans to major in computer science.

Daniella Greenbaum is a Barnard College senior majoring in English literature. In a past life, she was president of Aryeh: Columbia Student Association for Israel. Daniella subsists on knitting and reruns of Golden Girls, and was certainly born in the wrong decade. She can be found at Hillel during most of the daylight hours, and a few nighttime ones as well. Her dog phobia is well-documented but poorly understood. Agree to Disagree runs alternate Mondays.
I am a Junior at Barnard studying Neuroscience and am also pre-med. I love to take photographs, dance, and play the flute.

Barnard College | 2020 
Mumbai | Singapore | NYC 
Economics | History | Law | International Affairs 
Travelling | Music -Tchaikovsky to Melanie Martinez- | Photography

Benjamin DuBow is a Columbia College junior majoring in English, and is damn proud of it. When not in the throes of his passionate love affair with etymology, Benjamin can be found loitering around campus, silently begging passersby to ask him why he never seems to have anything to do. Aside from perfecting his English major aesthetic, Benjamin incessantly trains his acting ability in the hope that he will someday star in a respectable on-campus production. He enjoys reading, telling people about his reading, cooking, hiking, scuba diving, beer, wine, whisky, sake, and exotic fruit. Questions? Comments? Dating advice? Send him a line at bnd2111@columbia.edu. Lions in a Concrete Jungle runs alternate Tuesdays.

Keenan Smith is a Columbia College junior, majoring in ethnicity and race studies. Keenan's identity as a Black, queer man greatly informs his subjects and his community building projects on and off campus. Keenan is from Flint, Michigan (yes, that Flint). You can find him around campus ranting about systemic oppression and socialized notions of value or drinking his second to third coffee at any one of the coffee shops in Morningside Heights. Against the White City runs alternate Fridays.

Canwen is a Columbia College first-year who specializes in living in states that no one cares about, including North Dakota, South Dakota, and Idaho. She would tell you her major but it changes about every five seconds (and who has time to update their bio that often?!).

Studies Music and German Literature and Culture in Columbia College. Loves the novels of P.G. Wodehouse -- Right Ho, Jeeves! -- and strongly suggests the music of Germaine Tailleferre (especially her Piano Trio).

I'm a sophomore in CC and a prospective Linguistics or Evolutionary Biology of the Human Species Major. In my spare time I love to knit and get caught up on the latest season of The Real Housewives of New York.

Luciana Siracusano is a Columbia College junior majoring in English, because she’s found that if you want to study everything and can’t decide, studying literature comes pretty close. Luciana spends most of her time trying to “be an artist”—whatever that means—and can be found frolicking across campus in her latest creative endeavor, or living the solitary life of a River Rat in her shafted River Hall single. A self-proclaimed idealist, Luciana enjoys perplexing cynics, which usually puts her in uncomfortable situations with most of her friends and classmates. Hailing from Manhattan, NYC is her home and inspiration. Waking Dreams runs alternate Wednesdays.

I am a sophomore in Columbia College planning to study computer science. I've loved living in New York City for my entire life, but whenever I need a break, worldwide travel is my escape. I've worked as a staff photographer at Spec for the past two years and I'm also president of the cycling club and an RA on campus.
I am a Junior at Barnard studying Neuroscience and am also pre-med. I love to take photographs, dance, and play the flute.
Colin is a class of 2017 student at the school of general studies studying applied mathematics.  He is a former Marine and staff illustrator for Spectator.

I am currently a sophomore in Columbia College studying political science and East Asian languages and cultures. Outside of my work at Spectator, I am in the Alpha chapter of Alpha Omicron Pi here at Columbia, the Taiwanese American Students Association, Undergraduate and Global Recruitment Committees as well as intern for NBC News / MSNBC.
Ethan Woo is an English and Comparative Literature major in the Class of 2020. Currently, he covers Undergraduate Student Life.

Elena Burger is a Barnard College junior majoring in history, with a cautious minor in economics. After spending most of her first two years on campus putting her energy into theater and film, she is now exploring journalism—mostly because she is attracted to thriving, lucrative, and uncompetitive industries. Having grown up in Washington D.C. and Sydney, Australia, Elena is a striking mix of Robert Redford as Bob Woodward in All the President's Men and Cate Blanchett (but only when she played Bob Dylan in I'm Not There). You can follow her on Twitter @VirtualElena. Unaccompanied Data Miner runs alternate Wednesdays.

I am a Columbia College sophomore, double majoring in American Studies and Sociology. Besides my involvement in Spectator Design, I am a tour guide, the Public Relations Vice President of Gamma Phi Beta, and Executive Board Member and Events Director of Youth for Debate.

I am an Art History major (and tentative Visual Arts double major) in the Columbia College class of 2020. When I'm not obsessing over art, creating art, or viewing art in the Met I'm pointing a camera and happily shooting photos for Spec!

Jesse Chase-Lubitz is in the School of General Studies and majoring in History and Evolutionary Biology. Prior to coming to Columbia, Jesse worked as a professional dancer. She enjoys writing for The Eye and had the most fun with the article, Unearthing the Underground in Spring 2016.

Daniella Greenbaum is a Barnard College senior majoring in English literature. In a past life, she was president of Aryeh: Columbia Student Association for Israel. Daniella subsists on knitting and reruns of Golden Girls, and was certainly born in the wrong decade. She can be found at Hillel during most of the daylight hours, and a few nighttime ones as well. Her dog phobia is well-documented but poorly understood. Agree to Disagree runs alternate Mondays.
Philipp (CC 2019) is studying East Asian Studies. He is interested in literature, religion, and intercultural dialogue. He loves getting lost in the city.

Aliza is a first year at Barnard College currently exploring what she will major in. Aliza loves to paint, doodle, sing, play guitar, eat cool foods, chill with her four brothers, be silly with friends, and go on runs in the park. She hopes to contribute some creativity during her time at Spec.
I am a potential English/creative writing major in Columbia College '20. I am also a member of the varsity track team.

q_results.role: Associate Features Editor for The Eye
q_results.bio: Ana Espinoza is a Columbia College sophomore majoring in English, with a very tentative concentration in Political Science. She spends her time editing articles for The Eye, reading books, and pretending to have read books.

I am a Columbia College (CC'19) student studying literature and applied math. I illustrate in my spare time- what little spare time a double major gets. In illustrating for The Columbia Spectator, I have found that the more contentious the piece, the more interesting it is for me to convey.
Rahil Kamath is a news staff writer for the Columbia Spectator. He is a member of the SEAS Class of 2020 and intends to major in Industrial Engineering / Operations Research.
Natalie Vibhagool is a Columbia College sophomore and Spectrum’s staff designer. She is in constant search of sushi, sleep, & her possible major.

David Sierra is a Columbia College junior majoring in English and women's and gender studies. They are a queer and trans writer and artist. You can find them sitting on the Q House stoop discussing structural oppression and intersectional feminist critique while wearing 9-inch platforms. They've written for MTV, performed at Brooklyn Arts Exchange, and organized with Fourth Arts Block. David grew up a small-town Ohio boy but always dreamed of becoming a big city girl. We’ll see what happens. Locate them on Twitter (@davidleesierra) and Instagram (@davidleesierra). Sex(uality) and the City runs alternate Fridays.

Daniella is a member of the Class of 2017 at Barnard College with a major in Psychology and a minor in Economics. When she's not making sports graphics for Spec you will likely find her making a graphic for organizations around campus, planning an event for Gamma Phi Beta, or studying in Butler.
Freshman in CC studying biochemistry with a passion for space and aesthetics.
https://twitter.com/jsonkao

Noah Sheidlower is the 145th Arts & Entertainment Editor who hails from Great Neck, NY. He writes primarily about food, film, and music. He can be reached at noah.sheidlower@columbiaspectator.com. Follow him on Twitter @Nsheidlower.

Andrew Park is a senior staff writer covering women's basketball and baseball. He previously served as the 147th Managing Editor and the 146th Graphics Editor at the Columbia Daily Spectator. Email him at andrew.park@columbiaspectator.com and follow him on Twitter @androo_park.

awards.name: SPJ Mark of Excellence Video Game Reporting Finalist

q_results.bio: Lizzie Karpen is the 145th managing editor of Spectator. Previously, she served as the 144th sports editor. She studies political science and English at Barnard and is a member of the class of 2022. Email her at elizabeth.karpen@columbiaspectator.com and follow her on Twitter @lizziekarpen

Katherine Nessel is a staff writer in city news and a member of the investigations desk. She covers transportation, housing, and political issues. She studies urban studies and Asian and Middle Eastern cultures at Barnard College and is a member of the class of 2023. Email her at katherine.nessel@columbiaspectator.com

Stephanie Lai is a deputy news editor focusing on enterprise and investigations and previously served on the 144th Managing Board as a news editor. Lai is a member of the class of 2022 in Columbia College. Email her at stephanie.lai@columbiaspectator.com and follow her on Twitter @stephaniealai.

Sarah Braka is the 145th editor in chief of Spectator. She is a senior studying chemical engineering at the School of Engineering and Applied Science. Email her at sarah.braka@columbiaspectator.com and follow her on Twitter @sarahbraka.

Dia Gill is the managing editor on the 146th Managing Board overseeing all journalism sections. She studies sociology at Columbia College and is a member of the class of 2023. Email her at dia.gill@columbiaspectator.com and follow her on Twitter @_diagill.

Kathy Fang is a photographer and staff writer in University news. She studies comparative literature and theater at Columbia College and is a member of the class of 2024. Email her at kathy.fang@columbiaspectator.com.
Megan Lunny is a Senior Staff Writer for The Eye studying English and Human Rights at Columbia College. Email her at megan.lunny@columbiaspectator.com.

Abby Melbourne is a deputy news editor in University news. She studies political science, human rights, and philosophy at Barnard and is a member of the class of 2022. Email her at abby.melbourne@columbiaspectator.com and follow her on Twitter @abby_melbourne.

Faith Andrews-O’Neal is a deputy city news editor and a member of the investigations desk. She covers health and environmental issues within West Harlem. She studies political science and ethnicity and race studies at Columbia College and is a member of the class of 2024. Email her at faith.andrews@columbiaspectator.com.

Carmen Sherlock is a staff writer in city news. She is an American studies major at Barnard and a member of the class of 2021. Email her at carmen.sherlock@columbiaspectator.com and follow her on Twitter @carmindelilah.

Swethaa Radhika Suresh is a deputy editor for Spectrum and a junior at Barnard College studying computer science and economics. She can often be found watching French cartoons or Korean shows in an attempt to improve her language skills, or exploring New York City’s performing arts scene. She can be reached at swethaa.suresh@columbiaspectator.com.

Charlotte Wu is a staff writer for Spectrum and a sophomore at Barnard College double majoring in English and educational studies. In her free time, she likes to explore the city and do creative writing. Charlotte can be reached at charlotte.wu@columbiaspectator.com.

Zach Schermele is a deputy news editor covering University news and investigations. He studies political science and is a member of the Class of 2023. Email him at zachary.schermele@columbiaspectator.com and follow him on Twitter @zachschermele.

Katie Levine is a Deputy Editor in A&E. She studies Art History and Economics at Barnard College and is a member of the class of 2023. She is most interested in highlighting students' contributions to diversity and sustainability in the arts industry. Email her at katie.levine@columbiaspectator.com and follow her on Twitter @itskatielevine.

Sofia Kwon is a news editor on the 145th Managing Board overseeing city news and a member of the investigations desk. She studies creative writing and English at Columbia College and is a member of the class of 2023. Email her at sofia.kwon@columbiaspectator.com and follow her on Twitter @sofiamkwon.

Maya Mitrasinovic is the city news editor on the 146th Managing Board. She is a member of the Columbia College class of 2023 majoring in urban studies with a specialization in sociology, with interests in education, policy, and affordable housing. Reach out to her at maya.mitrasinovic@columbiaspectator.com or on Twitter @m_mitrasinovic.

Kelly Ann Cosentino is a staff writer in University news. She studies ancient studies and classics at Columbia College and is a member of the class of 2023. Email her at kelly.ann.cosentino@columbiaspectator.com.
Jane Mok is a senior at Barnard College studying Cognitive Science and Computer Science. At Spectator, she is a staff photographer. Reach her at jane.mok@columbiaspectator.com

Rommel Nunez is a junior at the School of Engineering and Applied Science studying Computer Science and English. At Spectator, he is a senior staff photographer. Reach him at rommel.nunez@columbiaspectator.com

Aliza Rabinovitz is a deputy editor for Spectrum and a junior at the School of Engineering and Applied Science majoring in computer science and potentially minoring in sociology. She enjoys kickboxing, running, listening to podcasts, and exploring the city whenever she can. She can be reached at aliza.rabinovitz@columbiaspectator.com.
Miles Schachner is the 146th Sports Editor of the Columbia Daily Spectator. He covers men's basketball and baseball.

Emma Cho is a deputy editor for Spectrum and a sophomore at Columbia College studying German and economic history. Born and raised in New Orleans, Emma has a deep passion for Southern comfort food and enjoys exploring new restaurants in New York City. She can be reached at emma.cho@columbiaspectator.com.

Irie Sentner, CC '24, is Spectator's 147th editor in chief and president of Spectator Publishing Company. He formerly served as University News Editor and co-director of the 2022 Spectator Summer Fellowship Program. Email him at irie.sentner@columbiaspectator.com and follow him on Twitter @iriesentner.

Stella Pagkas is a University news Deputy Editor. She studies English and political science at Columbia College and is a member of the class of 2024. Email her at stella.pagkas@columbiaspectator.com and follow her on Twitter @stellapagkas.
Claire Hunt is a City News Senior Staff Writer. She is a combined Women's Studies and English Major, concentrating in creative writing, at Barnard College. Follow her on X @ClaireEHunt1.

Alice Tecotzky is a staff writer in city news with a special interest in education reporting. She is studying English and history at Columbia College and is a member of the class of 2024. Email her at alice.tecotzky@columbiaspectator.com.

Haley Long is a deputy editor for Spectrum and a sophomore at Columbia College studying history. Haley is from Providence, Rhode Island, which has given her a deep and lasting appreciation for walkable cities. She also has really nice handwriting and can fall asleep sitting up. She can be reached at haley.long@columbiaspectator.com.
Selina is a junior studying Economics and Statistics. Reach her at selina.yang@columbiaspectator.com
Deputy Sports Editor

Michelle Twan is a staff writer for Spectrum, and she transferred to Barnard in fall 2021, where she is now a sophomore studying economics and is also on the pre-med track. In her free time, she enjoys writing poetry and fiction, and she also indulges in oil painting. She can be reached at michelle.twan@columbiaspectator.com

Esha Karam is Spectator's 148th Managing Editor. She studies sustainable development at Columbia College and is a member of the class of 2025. Email her at esha.karam@columbiaspectator.com and follow her on X @esha_karam.

Kylie Gall is a staff writer for Spectrum and a sophomore majoring in history at Barnard, concentrating in legal and political history. Born and raised in New Jersey, Kylie is passionate about the superiority of the Jersey bagel to its New York counterpart. The same goes for pizza. She can be reached at kylie.gall@columbiaspectator.com.

Caroline Somers is a staff writer for Spectrum and a first-year at Columbia College. She tends to switch her major a lot, but is probably going to stick with computer science because that’s what the cool kids are doing. She enjoys going on bike rides with her pet cockatiel, Cricket. She can be reached at caroline.somers@columbiaspectator.com.

Sophie Dau is a City News Senior Staff Writer. She studies History and Gender Studies at Barnard College and is a member of the class of 2025. Email her at sophie.dau@columbiaspectator.com and follow her on X @sophie__dau.

Amira McKee is a City News Editor. She studies Sociology at Columbia College and is a member of the class of 2025. Email her at amira.mckee@columbiaspectator.com and follow her on Twitter @_amiramckee.

Nour Kandil is a staff writer for Spectrum and a first-year at Barnard on the pre-med track. She is very passionate about advocacy and has participated in several political campaigns. Nour loves to read and go on walks—you can often find her at Riverside Park. She can be reached at nour.kandil@columbiaspectator.com

Veronica Wang is a staff writer for Spectrum and a junior at Barnard studying sociology and political science. She also has a huge passion for sustainability. Veronica loves traveling, photography, and getting more than 10 hours of sleep every day. She can be reached at chun.wang@columbiaspectator.com.

Ruby Zeidman is a staff writer for Spectrum and a sophomore at Barnard studying psychology. When she’s not in class or at the library, she’s probably getting coffee or on a walk. Ruby can be reached at ruby.zeidman@columbiaspectator.com.

Fatima AlAryani is a staff writer at Spectrum and a first-year at Columbia College majoring in Middle Eastern studies and creative writing. She floats between Ajman, United Arab Emirates;New York City;and her secret inner realm. She's often thinking about her next cup of coffee or the sea. She can be reached at fatma.alaryani@columbiaspectator.com.

Bella Druckman was the Arts & Entertainment Editor for the 146th Managing Board. She is studying English and Urban History at Barnard College where she is a member of the Class of 2024. She writes primarily about food, film, and pop culture. Email her at bella.druckman@columbiaspectator.com and follow her on Twitter @bella_druckman.

Esther Sun is a City News Editor. She is an Urban Studies major at Columbia College and a member of the class of 2025. Email her at esther.sun@columbiaspectator.com and follow her on Twitter @esthercsun.

Dylan Andres is a University News Senior Staff Writer. She studies History at Columbia College and is a member of the class of 2025. Email her at dylan.andres@columbiaspectator.com and follow her on X @dyllandres.
Isabella Ramírez is Spectator’s 148th Editor in Chief and President. She studies Sociology at Columbia College and is a member of the class of 2025.

Aissatou Diallo is a Senior Staff Writer for City News, covering Youth and Education and Health and Environment. She studies Urban Studies at Columbia College and is a member of the class of 2025. Email her at aissatou.diallo@columbiaspectator.com and follow her on X @iceatwodiallo.

Rose O’Brien is a staff writer for Spectrum and a first-year tentatively studying urban studies with a concentration in political science at Barnard. Rose is from a small town in Maine where she raises sheep. She enjoys running in the park and exploring affordable restaurants. Rose can be reached at rose.obrien@columbia.spectator.com.

Rainier Harris is a City News Deputy Editor. He studies English at Columbia College and is a member of the class of 2025. Email him at rainier.harris@columbiaspectator.com and follow him on X @harris_rainier.
Lilienne Shore Kilgore-Brown is a Senior Staff Writer at The Eye studying English and Hispanic Studies at Columbia College. Contact her at lilienne.kilgore-brown@columbiaspectator.com

Irene Madrigal is a Deputy Editor of Arts & Culture. She studies English and History at Barnard College and is a member of the class of 2024. She oversees the Food & Drink beat and is always down to try new restaurants in the city or catch the latest movie in theaters. Email her at irene.madrigal@columbiaspectator.com.

Noah Bullwinkle is an Arts and Entertainment deputy editor. He studies English at Columbia College and is a member of the class of 2024. He is most interested in music. Email him at noah.bullwinkle@columbiaspectator.com.

Isabella "Isa" Farfan is the editor of Arts & Culture. She studies Political Science at Barnard College and is a member of the class of 2024. She writes mostly about food, art, and pop culture. Email her at isabella.farfan@columbiaspectator.com

Liz Radway is a Staff Writer in Arts & Entertainment. She studies Computer Science and Dance at Columbia College and is a member of the class of 2024. She is most interested in dance and technology. Email her at radwayliz@gmail.com.

Holly Qu is a staff writer in Arts & Entertainment. She studies English at Columbia College and is a member of the class of 2024. She loves to keep up with the art scene on campus, and writes most about art and architecture. In her spare time, she enjoys reading and playing Sudoku. Email her at holly.qu@columbiaspectator.com.

Jane Loughman is a staff writer in Arts & Entertainment. She studies English at General Studies and is a member of the class of 2022. She primarily writes about and reviews campus theater. Email her at jane.loughman@columbiaspectator.com and follow her on Twitter @queen.of.quirk.
